intro: Helmiopsis calcicola, commonly known as the calcicola helmiopsis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that thrives in rocky, arid environments, often found in limestone soils. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom during the cooler months. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to store water in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Helmiopsis calcicola is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
